channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024020172
item.description:
Report X-2024020172

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO DMP AFTER BEING DISCOVERED BY SUPERVISOR AMIDST OTHER PACKAGES WHICH WERE WET WITH RAINWATER. THE PACKAGE APPEARED TO BE SLIGHTLY DAMP ON THE BOTTOM WHERE IT STOOD, SO IT WAS PRESUMED TO HAVE BEEN ALSO DAMAGED BY RAINWATER (COLORLESS LIQUID). RESPONDER DISCOVERED THAT THE PACKAGE CONTINUED LEAKING. RESPONDER DETERMINED AT THIS TIME THAT IT WAS LIKELY ACTUALLY A LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER PROCESSED LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE THROUGH DMP PROCEDURES.

item.title: Report X-2024020016
item.description:
Report X-2024020016

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: REDMOND
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO MULTIPLE WET AND FROZEN PKGS IN A TRAILER AT AROUND DOOR 6 UNLOAD. RESPONDER DISCOVERED THIS PACKAGE APPEARED FROZEN CAUSING JUGS TO EXPAND AND LEAK FROM SEALED CAPS.

item.title: Report X-2024010715
item.description:
Report X-2024010715

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered by workers to be wet and having an odor. Trained personal retrieved the package and proceeded to inspect. Proper procedures implemented to handle package according to FedEx policy. DescribePack: Package was inadequately prepared to hold and brace material. No packing. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: No spilled material presented for clean up. Package contained in proper Hazmat bucket lined with heavy duty plastic bag.

item.title: Report X-2024010716
item.description:
Report X-2024010716

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: REDMOND
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WAS LEAKING AND BROUGHT TO THE DAMAGES AREA DescribePack: THERE WAS A PUNCTURE/CRACK ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IT WAS PUT IN A PASTIC HAZMAT BAG AND PLACE IN HAZMAT TUB AND BROUGHT TO HAZMAT CAGE AND PUT UNDER THE VENT
